skills.name: Place value, naming and rounding whole numbers
skills.description: Place value to millions, compare, order, word names, Roman numerals and rounding; includes even/odd rules.

templates.stem: Write the number {n} in words.
Round {n} to the nearest thousand.

skills.name: Whole number operations and estimation
skills.description: Add, subtract, multiply and divide whole numbers; properties, missing digits, inequalities, mixed operations and estimation.

templates.stem: Calculate: {a} + {b} - {c}
Estimate: {a} × {b} by rounding each number to the nearest ten.

skills.name: Exponents and number theory
skills.description: Basic exponents, powers, factors, primes, divisibility, prime factorisation, HCF and LCM.

templates.stem: Evaluate: {a}^{p}.
What is the highest common factor (HCF) of {a} and {b}?

skills.name: Fractions and mixed numbers
skills.description: Understand, compare and create equivalent fractions and mixed numbers; convert, round and find fractions of wholes and groups.

templates.stem: Simplify the fraction {num}/{den}.
A group has {total} students. {num}/{den} of them like football. How many students is that? (Round your answer to the nearest whole student.)

skills.name: Add and subtract fractions and mixed numbers
skills.description: Add and subtract fractions and mixed numbers with like and related denominators, estimate and use inequalities.

templates.stem: Calculate: {a}/{b} + {c}/{b}.
Calculate: {w1} {a}/{b} − {w2} {c}/{b}.

skills.name: Decimals and decimal operations
skills.description: Understand, compare and convert decimals and fractions; add, subtract, multiply and divide decimals; estimate and compare.

templates.stem: Calculate: {x} + {y}.
Convert the decimal {x} to a fraction in simplest form.

skills.name: Percents basics
skills.description: Understand percents, convert between percents and fractions, and find percent of a number.

templates.stem: What is {p}% of {n}?
Write {p}% as a fraction in simplest form.

skills.name: Money and financial literacy
skills.description: Work with money amounts, unit prices, change, and simple budgets and records.

templates.stem: An item costs ${price} and you pay with ${paid}. How much change should you receive?
You earn ${income} and spend ${spend}. What is your balance?

skills.name: Number sequences and simple equations
skills.description: Complete arithmetic and geometric sequences and solve one-step equations; use simple two-variable tables and graphs.

templates.stem: The sequence increases by {step} each time. The first term is {first}. What is the 5th term?
Solve the equation: x + {a} = {b}.

skills.name: Time, schedules and elapsed time
skills.description: Convert time units, find elapsed time, and interpret schedules and timelines.

templates.stem: A movie starts at {start} and ends at {end}. How many minutes long is it?

skills.name: Metric measurement and temperature
skills.description: Choose appropriate metric units and convert between length, mass and volume units; reason about temperature.

templates.stem: Convert {cm} centimetres to metres.

skills.name: 2D and 3D shapes, symmetry and measurement
skills.description: Identify polygons and 3D shapes, work with angles, symmetry, perimeter, area and volume of cubes and rectangular prisms.

templates.stem: Find the area of a rectangle with length {l} cm and width {w} cm.
A rectangular prism has length {l} cm, width {w} cm and height {h} cm. What is its volume?

skills.name: Data, graphs, statistics and probability
skills.description: Read and create common graphs, calculate mean/median/mode, and work with simple probability and combinations.

templates.stem: A bag has {r} red and {b} blue counters. What is the probability of picking a red counter?
What is the mean of {a}, {b}, and {c}?
Find the area of a composite shape made of a rectangle {l}×{w} cm and a triangle with base {b} cm and height {h} cm.
Two angles are vertically opposite. If one is {a}°, what is the other?
Find the complement of {a}°.
Find the volume of a triangular prism with base area {a} cm² and height {h} cm.

skills.name: Whole numbers, place value and properties
skills.description: Place value, naming, Roman numerals, properties of addition and multiplication, estimation and mixed operations with whole numbers.

templates.stem: Estimate: {a} + {b} by rounding each number to the nearest hundred.
Calculate: {a} × {b} ÷ {c}.

skills.name: Powers of ten, exponents and number theory
skills.description: Understanding and evaluating powers of ten and other exponents; square roots; factors, primes, HCF, LCM and multiplicative inverses.

templates.stem: Write {a} × {a} × {a} using an exponent.
Estimate the square root of {n}.

skills.name: Decimals and decimal operations
skills.description: Decimal place value, ordering, rounding, number lines, and operations with decimals including estimation and maps.

templates.stem: Put these decimals in order from least to greatest: {x}, {y}, {z}.
Calculate: {x} × {y}.

skills.name: Fractions, mixed numbers and rational numbers
skills.description: Review and compare fractions and mixed numbers, convert between forms, add and subtract fractions and mixed numbers, and work with rational numbers.

templates.stem: Convert the improper fraction {num}/{den} to a mixed number.
Calculate: {a}/{b} + {c}/{d}.

skills.name: Integers and integer operations
skills.description: Understanding, representing, comparing and ordering integers; adding and subtracting integers using rules and representations.

templates.stem: Calculate: {a} + {b}.
Order these integers from least to greatest: {a}, {b}, {c}.

skills.name: Ratios, rates, proportions and percents
skills.description: Ratios, equivalent ratios, unit rates, proportions, scale drawings, percents and percent applications including GST, discounts and interest.

templates.stem: Write a ratio of {a} to {b} in simplest form.
An item costs ${price} and is discounted by {p}%. What is the sale price?

skills.name: Problem solving and estimation
skills.description: Use estimation, multi-step reasoning, logical strategies and spatial reasoning to solve word problems.

templates.stem: Jamal estimates {a} + {b} by rounding each number to the nearest ten. What estimate does he get?

skills.name: Expressions, equations and two-variable relationships
skills.description: Write and evaluate variable expressions, use properties, solve one-step equations, and work with two-variable equations and graphs.

templates.stem: Evaluate 2x + 3y when x = {x} and y = {y}.
Solve: x - {a} = {b}.

skills.name: 2D and 3D geometry, symmetry and transformations
skills.description: Work with polygons, triangles, quadrilaterals, circles, angle relationships, symmetry, transformations, congruent and similar figures, nets and views of 3D shapes, and perimeter, area, and volume.

templates.stem: Find the area of a triangle with base {b} cm and height {h} cm.
A cube has side length {s} cm. What is its volume?

skills.name: Units, time, money and consumer maths
skills.description: Estimate and convert metric units, work with temperature, money operations, sale prices, GST and interest, and solve time and schedule problems.

templates.stem: Convert {km} kilometres to metres.

skills.name: Data, graphs, statistics and probability
skills.description: Create and interpret a wide range of graphs and tables, calculate measures of centre and spread, and work with simple and compound probability.

templates.stem: A data set has values {a}, {b}, {c}, {d}. What is the median?
A line has gradient {m} and y-intercept {c}. What is y when x = {x}?
The equation of a line is y = {m}x + {c}. What is the y-intercept?
A bag contains {r} red and {b} blue marbles. Two marbles are drawn without replacement. What is the probability both are red?

skills.name: Number classification, factors and multiples
skills.description: Prime/composite, prime factorisation, divisibility, HCF, LCM, multiplicative inverses and classifying numbers.

templates.stem: Write {n} as a product of prime factors.

skills.name: Integers and integer operations
skills.description: Represent, compare and order integers; work with absolute value and perform all four operations with integers in expressions and word problems.

templates.stem: Calculate: {a} - {b}.

skills.name: Decimals and decimal operations
skills.description: Review, compare and order decimals; perform all four operations with decimals including estimation, expressions, inequalities and map distances.

templates.stem: Evaluate: {x} + {y} × {z}.

skills.name: Fractions, mixed numbers and rational numbers
skills.description: Compare, convert and operate with fractions and mixed numbers and extend these ideas to rational numbers, including absolute value and ordering.

templates.stem: Calculate: {a}/{b} × {c}/{d}.

skills.name: Exponents, standard form and roots
skills.description: Work with powers and exponents, including variable and fractional bases, standard form, square and cube roots, and estimation.

templates.stem: Evaluate: ({a})^{p}.

skills.name: Ratios, rates, proportions and proportional reasoning
skills.description: Work with ratios, unit rates, proportions, scale drawings, population estimates and rate of change including speed and time problems.

templates.stem: A recipe uses {a} cups of sugar for {b} servings. How much sugar is needed for {c} servings if the relationship is proportional?

skills.name: Percents and consumer maths
skills.description: Represent and compute percents of quantities, reverse percent problems, and apply percents to real-life contexts such as GST, discounts, mark-ups, interest and budgeting.

templates.stem: An item costing ${price} is discounted by {p}%. What is the sale price?

skills.name: Problem solving, estimation and time
skills.description: Use estimation strategies and structured methods such as guess-and-check, Venn diagrams and schedule interpretation to solve complex word problems.

templates.stem: Estimate the result of {a} × {b} by rounding both numbers to one significant figure.

skills.name: Metric units and precision
skills.description: Select appropriate metric units, convert and compare units including area and volume, and understand precision.

templates.stem: Convert {m2} square metres to hectares.

skills.name: Coordinate plane and distance
skills.description: Work with all four quadrants of the coordinate plane, follow directions and find distance between points.

templates.stem: Find the distance between the points ({x1}, {y1}) and ({x2}, {y2}).

skills.name: Sequences and patterns
skills.description: Identify, extend and represent arithmetic and geometric sequences, and connect them to variable expressions.

templates.stem: The arithmetic sequence starts at {first} and increases by {step}. What is the 10th term?

skills.name: Expressions, properties and equations
skills.description: Write and evaluate expressions, use properties and like terms, and solve one- and two-step equations and related word problems.

templates.stem: Simplify: {a}x + {b}x.

skills.name: Two-variable equations and graphs
skills.description: Interpret, represent and graph two-variable linear relationships using equations, tables and graphs.

templates.stem: The equation is y = {m}x + {c}. What is y when x = {x}?

skills.name: 2D figures, lines and transformations
skills.description: Classify polygons and angles, work with angle relationships and polygon sums, lines and transversals, and perform transformations, congruence and similarity.

templates.stem: Find the missing angle in a triangle with angles {a}° and {b}°.

skills.name: Perimeter, area and volume
skills.description: Calculate perimeter and area of rectangles, parallelograms and triangles, and volume of cubes, prisms and cylinders, including compound figures.

templates.stem: Find the volume of a cylinder with radius {r} cm and height {h} cm. Use π ≈ 3.14.

skills.name: Data, graphs, statistics and probability
skills.description: Create and interpret many graph types, work with box plots and scatter plots, identify statistical questions, analyse samples, and calculate and interpret probabilities.

templates.stem: A data set has values {a}, {b}, {c}, {d}, {e}. What is the range?
In a right triangle, opposite = {opp} cm, adjacent = {adj} cm, hypotenuse = {hyp} cm. Find sin A to 3 decimal places.
Find cos A.
The radius of a circle is {r} cm. What is the diameter?
A central angle is {a}°. What is the inscribed angle subtended by the same arc?

skills.name: Number theory and classification
skills.description: Factors, divisibility, primes, HCF, LCM and classification of numbers including rational and irrational.

templates.stem: Is √{n} rational or irrational?

skills.name: Integers and rational number operations
skills.description: Work with integers on number lines and absolute value, and perform all operations on rational numbers in context and in expressions.

templates.stem: Evaluate: {a} - ({b}).

skills.name: Exponents, roots and standard form
skills.description: Evaluate and simplify expressions with integer exponents, including negative exponents and exponent rules; work with square and cube roots and convert between ordinary numbers and standard form.

templates.stem: Simplify: {a}^{p} × {a}^{q}.

skills.name: Ratios, rates and proportional relationships
skills.description: Use ratios, rates and proportions, including population estimates and scale, and connect them to proportional relationships and graphs.

templates.stem: The graph of a proportional relationship has constant of proportionality {k}. What is y when x = {x}?

skills.name: Percents, percent change and consumer maths
skills.description: Convert and compare percents, compute and interpret percents and percent change, and apply them to GST, discounts, mark-up, and interest.

templates.stem: The price increases from ${old} to ${newPrice}. What is the percent change?

skills.name: Metric units, rates and precision
skills.description: Convert rates and measurements including area and volume, and reason about precision and appropriate units.

templates.stem: Convert {m3} cubic metres to litres.

skills.name: Problem solving with word problems and time
skills.description: Solve multi-step and structured word problems, including Venn diagrams and elapsed time problems.

templates.stem: A journey starts at {start} and ends at {end}. How many minutes long is the journey?

skills.name: Coordinate plane and distance
skills.description: Review and use the coordinate plane in all quadrants and find distances between points.

templates.stem: Find the distance between ({x1}, {y1}) and ({x2}, {y2}).

skills.name: 2D geometry, angle relationships and circles
skills.description: Classify polygons and quadrilaterals, use angle relationships, work with transversals and circle parts.

templates.stem: Find the missing angle formed by complementary angles if one is {a}°.

skills.name: Transformations, congruence and similarity
skills.description: Perform and describe reflections, rotations, translations and dilations, and reason with congruent and similar figures.

templates.stem: A dilation with scale factor {k} is applied to a segment of length {len}. What is the new length?

skills.name: Pythagoras' theorem, area, surface area and volume
skills.description: Apply Pythagoras' theorem and its converse and compute perimeter, area, surface area and volume for a range of 2D and 3D shapes including spheres and similar solids.

templates.stem: In a right triangle, the legs are {a} cm and {b} cm. Find the hypotenuse, to one decimal place.

skills.name: Sequences and series
skills.description: Identify and represent arithmetic and geometric sequences, including writing expressions for terms.

templates.stem: An arithmetic sequence has first term {a1} and common difference {d}. What is the nth term?

skills.name: Expressions, polynomials and properties
skills.description: Write and evaluate expressions, work with radicals and rationals, simplify linear expressions using properties and like terms, and add, subtract and multiply polynomials.

templates.stem: Simplify: ({a}x + {b}) + ({c}x + {d}).

skills.name: Equations and inequalities
skills.description: Solve one-step to multi-step linear equations and inequalities, including equations with like terms and word problems.

templates.stem: Solve: {a}x + {b} = {c}.

skills.name: Linear and nonlinear functions
skills.description: Work with linear functions including gradient and graphing, compare linear models, and recognise and evaluate nonlinear functions.

templates.stem: A line has gradient {m} and passes through (0, {c}). What is its equation in the form y = mx + c?

skills.name: Data, graphs, statistics and probability
skills.description: Interpret and create a variety of graphs, calculate and interpret measures of centre and spread, work with box plots and scatter plots, and calculate probabilities including independent and dependent events.

templates.stem: A spinner has {a} red, {b} blue and {c} green sectors of equal size. What is the probability of spinning blue or green?
Expand (x + {a})(x + {b}).
Factorise x² + {a}x + {b}.
